definition[0]: a situation in which two or more people, teams, or companies are competing for something, especially over a long period of time, and the feeling of competition between them
example[0]: The two players have developed a friendly rivalry.
example[1]: She had never overcome her feelings of sibling rivalry  (=rivalry between brothers and sisters).
example[2]: There has always been intense rivalry between New Zealand and Australia.
definition[1]: competition between people, companies, organizations etc who are in the same business or selling similar goods or services in the same market
example[3]: There is considerable rivalry between banks and accountancy firms when it comes to giving corporate financial advice.
